item.title: Resources
item.description: Collaborative writing Reproducibility of workflows General In R Papers talking about reproducible science Books Collaborative writing Authorea advantages disadvantages WYSIWYG online editor no LaTeX share project and data with a group only up to 3 private documents at a time with the free account writing in real time version history include code behind figures ease of inserting citations publish from within the app Overleaf

item.title: Git and github
item.description: Git software Git in RStudio Cloning a repository Adding git tracking to an existing project Some tutorials When you run into trouble… GitHub Github features Git and GitHub are connected, but these are not the same. Let’s see what’s the difference. Git software Git software can be downloaded for all OS types. Moreover, there are many software pieces that give you git access, e.

item.title: Version control
item.description: Too many versions? Take control! Directories Naming strategy Version control What to version control? Examples src: http://phdcomics.com/comics/archive.php?comicid=1323 Too many versions? We produce very many files, scripts, notes, code, data, outputs, drafts, reports, you-name-it… It’s important to have a clear strategy for how to maintain order in those and how to track changes or versions - either made by us or others. Take control! Here are some tips

item.title: Digital note-taking
item.description: Note-taking Organization Links To think, you have to write. If you’re thinking without writing, you only think you’re thinking — Leslie Lamport, Thinking for Programmers Note-taking Important to take notes, both via hand-writing, but also digital notes. Advantages of digital notes: searchable ease of planning facilitates writing manuscripts keeping track of trials - mistakes and failures are as important as successes! Organization Organize your thoughts, links, workflows, etc.
